info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 02 at 7:23PM MDT until October 02 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN UNION COUNTY... At 723 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles west of Kenton, or 27 miles north of Clayton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Grenville, Clayton Lake State Park, Seneca, and Moses. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 401 and 405. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: While hail has subsided, this storm will still be capable of producing abrupt wind gusts to 60 mph.
